intro: Curtia ayangannae, commonly known as the Ayangannae tree, is a species native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is a medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 15–20 meters. The plant has simple, opposite, elliptical leaves that are dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, producing a distinctive fragrance. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in the forest ecosystem.
